page.title: 17TOURISM- CLAYBROOKE MAGNA
page.content: TOURIST GUIDE TO CLAYBROOKE MAGNA Smithy Cottage -site of blacksmiths Bell St. named after the Blue Bell Inn (now private house - The White House) Woodcutter Inn originally Royal Oak. Disused chapel near Post Office. New housing estate on site of original woodyard owned by Mr. Coltman. Down Back Lane is Vineyard Cottage (yeoman farmer's cottage) -see slide. Whitemores timber mill and yard Mrs. Billett's newsagents & general stores - once the Sadler's Shop. Village Hall - donated by Quakers Bull's Head Inn Along road to Frolesworth is Claybrooke Mill built in 1763, recently restored to working order. On site adjacent to the mill was the wind mill mentioned in the Domesday Book. .
